text:
JSON-LD snippets embedded in webpages are amazing, and show up all over the place randomly.
And thanks to <http://schema.org|schema.org> are consistent enough to be useful
Anyone actually found use for them?

DataDepsGenerators.jl uses them to generate julia code to download datasets, while keeping all metadata; which is cool because it works for tons of different sites.

are consistent enough to be useful
Anyone actually found use for them?

DataDepsGenerators.jl uses them to generate julia code to download datasets, while keeping all metadata; which is cool because it works for tons of different sites.

text:
It’s too bad GitHub doesn’t use them anywhere except in emails.
(and in emails they don’t include quite enough content to be useful)
GitLab also only uses them for like the breadcrumb list for navigation.

GitLab also only uses them for like the breadcrumb list for navigation.

text:
I guess a lot of the problem is people only use them specifically to meet googles needs which is great when google does something like “Google Dataset Search”, because suddenly all datasets get them.
But not great if you want something that google doesn’t
